definitions.definition: to clean especially a floor by using a brush to collect the dirt into one place from which it can be removed:
a movement, especially a quick, powerful one or one to search an area:
examples: With a sweep (= horizontal movement) of its tail, the alligator knocked her under the water.

definitions.definition: a long, often curved, area of land, sea, river, etc.:
examples: A broad sweep of flat countryside stretched to the horizon in all directions.
